issue.title: [C++][CI] Add an appveyor CI job for VisualStudio 2019, non-conda
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-14075](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14075). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
From:
https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11211#pullrequestreview-761128572

ARROW-14070 removes the VisualStudio 2015 job, which does not use conda packages for dependencies. It'd be useful to test with a newer compiler (existing jobs use VS2017) as well as checking that we can build with a non-conda dependency source (perhaps vcpkg)

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14075?focusedCommentId=17418780) by Ian Cook (icook):*
FYI there is one crossbow job **test-build-vcpkg-win** that uses VS 2019 and uses vcpkg to install dependencies.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14075?focusedCommentId=17458587) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
There is a VS 2019 + Windows 2019 job on Github Actions, with C++17 enabled. Do we want to add some other configuration still?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14075?focusedCommentId=17521716) by Jacob Wujciak-Jens (assignUser):*
With crossbow and gha there a two different non-conda builds being checked with vs19. If there are any other, specific setups we should test please create another issue `[~bkietz]`
